title: Ask HN: How to earn some side income as a young developer?
text:
For context, I am about to turn 17 and have experience developing full stack web apps for fun, and for friends and family for around 6 years now.

I would like to start building some financial independence so I can afford to travel and go to festivals etc. with friends. The default thing to do at my age is get a minimum wage job at a pub/cafe and earn income that way, however I feel like I would rather work in something that complements my skills such as web/software development. The problem I am facing is I just have no idea to find some part time/freelance work at my age. Is it even worth chasing software work at 17 or should I just go for a waiter job and continue coding in my free time and developing skills while I am still in education?

Thanks

Show HN: A minimalist page builder to test as many business ideas as possible
text:
I built a minimalist page builder to test as many business ideas as possible

Back story:

Been struggling a lot to validate business ideas. Last year, I spent four months on an entire Job board SaaS, I only got a couple of signups (early users, developers), but I couldn’t sell and make money: $0 profit, only expenses :(

Decided to keep building SaaS, but with a new approach: before working on the upcoming SaaS ideas, I wanted to have an easy-and-fast way of having a coming soon page (landing page) that helps to collect early signups…

I don’t know if this is going to be helpful for other founders, but I’m hoping to run this business as a side project.

Would love to get some feedback,

Thanks!

What's your advice to someone learning DSA for interviews
text:
Problems I'm facing:

1) How long should I wait before I can't find a solution with my own brain?

2) Understand the solution when read it, but could not create the solution by myself.

3) Brain not picking up and solving problems. Dependent on solutions.

title: Telegram – The Kremlin Has Entered the Chat
Ask HN: Where is everyone finding interview partners for idea validation?
text:
The common advice is to talk to a lot of people to understand pain points and validate your idea as much as possible.

In B2B it's not always that easy to find the right people. Sure, cold calling/emailing works to a certain extend but is more or less a pure numbers game.

Is there something like a linkedin but for people who are willing to talk about their work, challenges, ...?

Alternatively, do you have any hacks how to find such people on linkedin?

Ask HN: ChatGPT must be banned immediately
text:
ChatGPT will have huge impact on jobs Many Software developers will lose their jobs. Due to this, they will be forced to choose other profession, there's no guarantee that, all those who lost job will find job in another field. I think this will have huge impact.

If we ban ChatGPT, we can have good future/opportunities for People in CS career.
